page.title: 11Fishing Trout River Avon
page.content: Mr Benstead is the{River Keeper}for 10 miles of trout water managed by the {Somerford Fishing Association (S.F.A.) formed in 1883. He plants weeds which encourage insect life for trout. He cleans the river of rubbish,surplus weed, fallen trees and he controls vermin especially wild mink.He stocks the river with trout every 3 to 4 weeks in the trout season.He supplies 3,000 trout each year.Fly fishing only is around{Kingsmead Mill}and a stretch near{Angrove Wood}but bait or fly is near Great Somerford.Members of the {S.F.A.}mostly come from the{Bristol area.The worst problem is pollution from sprays and industrial waste and pike which eat their own weight in fish in a week.They elecrify the water to stun pike and chub and take them to coarse fishing water.Pollution killed Grayling.It will take 10yr to replace.
